intro: Sphaerostephanos archboldii, commonly known as the Archbold's star-shaped flower, is a unique member of the Asteraceae family. It is native to the arid regions of southern Texas and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its striking, star-like yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It has a compact, shrub-like growth habit with small, gray-green leaves. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
